prompt_text: And so [Protagonist] finally escaped [Antagonist], married [Love Interest], and never had to [Abuse] again. [Only Friend] got a medal.
[Protagonist] stood tall at [Event Location], no longer a servant but an equal. [Love Interest] never let go of their hand.
[Protagonist] won. [Antagonist] lost everything. Some say justice was served. Others say it was revenge.
[Protagonist] forgave [Antagonist], which was honestly pretty weird given the whole [Abuse] thing. But hey, character growth!
With quiet dignity, [Protagonist] offered [Antagonist] forgiveness. [Only Friend] wept. Even [Love Interest] was moved.
[Protagonist] forgave them. It didn't fix anything. But it was the right thing to do.
In the end, neither could let go. [Protagonist] and [Antagonist] fell together, and [Event Location] would never recover.
Look, nobody knows what happened. [Antagonist] bit someone. [Protagonist] stole a horse. [Event Location] is now a crater.
They destroyed each other. [Only Friend] visits the ruins sometimes, wondering if it had to end this way.
[Protagonist] got out. Didn't look back. Last anyone heard, they were starting a small business with [Only Friend]. Good for them.
[Protagonist] walked away from [Antagonist], from [Event Location], from all of it. Freedom tasted like [Transformation Item].
[Protagonist] left everything behind. Even [Love Interest]. Some doors, once closed, stay closed.
When [Antagonist] revealed the truth—that they'd been protecting [Protagonist] all along—everything changed.
